conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram to determine the relationship between pressure and volume for the ideal gas.
The image shows a p-V diagram for an ideal gas with a curve from state A to B to C. State C is where the temperature is 300 K.
Use the ideal gas law: \( pV = nRT \) with constant \( n \) and \( R \).
At state C, \( p_1 = 5 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa} \) and \( V_1 = 3 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3 \). The temperature at state C is \( T_C = 300 \, \text{K} \).
To find \( T_B \) at state B, use \( T_B = \frac{p_2V_2}{nR} \).
Substitute values for state B: \( T_B = \frac{3 \times 10^5 \times 5 \times 10^{-3}}{\frac{5 \times 10^5 \times 3 \times 10^{-3}}{300}} = 300 \, \text{K} \).
The temperature in state B is the same as in state C.
